stem:
A 35-year-old patient presents with a history of pain in the sacroiliac joint for a month. He complains of morning stiffness and buttock pain.

Which of the following is least likely to be identified during the rest of the evaluation of this patient?
disc:
Lower back pain and stiffness which radiates to buttocks in a young person (usually <40 years) is a clue to diagnosing Ankylosing Spondylitis (AS). There may be associated loss of normal curvature of the lumbar spine, reduced chest expansion, and Achilles tendinitis. In addition, he may have transient peripheral arthritis (knee, shoulders, and hips), uveitis, osteopenia, and "Bamboo" spine later.

AS belongs to seronegative spondyloarthropathies which share common characteristics of
- Rheumatoid factor negative
- Involvement of spine and large joints
- Uveitis
- Enthesitis
- HLA B27 association

However subcutaneous nodules are found in 20% of patients with Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA). They are mostly over bony prominences. Rheumatoid nodules are the most common extra-articular manifestations of RA.
